unnormalised: New Guidelines Issued for Amarnath Yatra 2024
normalised: New Guidelines Issued for Amarnath Yatra two thousand and twenty four

unnormalised: Srinagar, J&K: The Shri Amarnathji Shrine Board (SASB) has announced new guidelines for the upcoming Amarnath Yatra, commencing on 29/06/2024. Pilgrims are advised to register online at jksasb.nic.in before 15/06/2024. A mandatory health certificate issued by authorized doctors is required, ensuring yatris are fit to trek the high-altitude route. Note that children below 13 yrs and senior citizens above 75 yrs are not permitted.
normalised: Srinagar, J and K: The S-A-S-B has announced new guidelines for the upcoming Amarnath Yatra, commencing on twenty ninth june two thousand and twenty four. Pilgrims are advised to register online at jksasb.nic.in before fifteenth june two thousand and twenty four. A mandatory health certificate issued by authorized doctors is required, ensuring yatris are fit to trek the high-altitude route. Note that children below thirteen years and senior citizens above seventy five years are not permitted.

unnormalised: The yatra routes, either via Baltal or Pahalgam, will be strictly monitored. The Baltal route is approx. 14 km, while the Pahalgam route stretches to 48 km. Yatris are encouraged to carry sufficient warm clothing and necessary medications. Ponies and palanquins are available for hire at designated points, with rates fixed by the SASB. Contact helpline number 1800-180-7198 for any assistance.
normalised: The yatra routes, either via Baltal or Pahalgam, will be strictly monitored. The Baltal route is approximately fourteen kilometer, while the Pahalgam route stretches to forty eight kilometer. Yatris are encouraged to carry sufficient warm clothing and necessary medications. Ponies and palanquins are available for hire at designated points, with rates fixed by the S-A-S-B. Contact helpline number one eight hundred, one hundred and eighty, seven thousand one hundred and ninety eight for any assistance.

unnormalised: Accommodation options include pre-fabricated huts and tents at Baltal and Nunwan base camps. These can be booked online or on arrival, subject to availability. Langars (community kitchens) will be set up by various organizations along the route, offering free meals. However, single-use plastic items are strictly prohibited to maintain the cleanliness of the area. The Yatra will conclude on 19/08/2024 (Raksha Bandhan).

unnormalised: The SASB has urged all pilgrims to adhere to the guidelines and cooperate with security personnel. Medical facilities and emergency services will be available at regular intervals along both routes. Travel insurance covering medical emergencies and evacuation is highly recommended. Yatris can purchase insurance online or at registration counters. Following these guidelines ensures a safe and fulfilling pilgrimage for all.
